name: Python
details: A high-level, interpreted language known for its simplicity and readability.

name: JavaScript
details: A versatile scripting language primarily used for web development.

name: Java
details: A class-based, object-oriented programming language used for various applications.

name: C++
details: An extension of C with object-oriented programming capabilities.

name: C#
details: A modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft.

name: Ruby
details: A dynamic, open-source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity.

name: Swift
details: A powerful programming language developed by Apple for iOS and macOS apps.

name: Kotlin
details: A modern, concise language that runs on the JVM and is used for Android development.

name: Go
details: A statically typed language developed by Google for efficiency and concurrency.

name: PHP
details: A popular general-purpose scripting language especially suited for web development.

name: Rust
details: A multi-paradigm language designed for safety and performance.

name: TypeScript
details: A strict syntactical superset of JavaScript that adds static typing.

name: SQL
details: A domain-specific language used for managing relational databases.

name: Perl
details: A high-level, general-purpose programming language known for text processing.

name: Dart
details: A programming language optimized for building fast, scalable apps.

name: Lua
details: A lightweight, high-performance scripting language for embedded systems.

name: MATLAB
details: A language designed for numerical computing and data visualization.

name: R
details: A programming language and environment for statistical computing and graphics.

name: Haskell
details: A purely functional programming language with strong static typing.

name: Scala
details: A high-level language that integrates functional and object-oriented programming.
